briefdescription.para: The larger integration grid for type 1 integrals, and for when the smaller grid fails for type 2 integrals.
The smaller integration grid, default for the type 2 integrals.
Even smaller grid for primitive integrals.
Modified spherical Bessel function of the first kind.
Tolerance for change below which an integral is considered converged.
This integrand simply returns the pretabulated integrand values stored in p given an index ix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< double > &r, int nr, int maxL, TwoIndex< double > &values, double weight=1.0) const
memberdef.name: buildBessel

detaileddescription.para:
Builds a matrix of Bessel at the given points up to the given maximum angular momentum.
r
- vector of points to evaluate at
nr
- number of points in r (for convenience)
maxL
- the maximum angular momentum needed
values
- TwoIndex<double> to store the values in
weight
- factor to weight r by (defaults to 1)

memberdef.argsstring: (double Na, double Nb, double zeta_a, double zeta_b, double R2) const
memberdef.name: calcKij

memberdef.argsstring: (const ECP &U, const int l, const int N, const GCQuadrature &grid, double *Utab) const
memberdef.name: buildU

detaileddescription.para:
Tabulate r^{N+2} times the ECP for all quadrature points.
U
- the ECP to be pretabulated
l
- the angular momentum shell of the ECP to be used
N
- the power of r to weight the ECP by
grid
- the quadrature grid to be used
Utab
- the array to put the values into.

memberdef.argsstring: (const GaussianShell &shell, double A, int lstart, int lend, const std::vector< double > &r, int nr, int start, int end, TwoIndex< double > &F) const
memberdef.name: buildF

detaileddescription.para:
Tabulate the F function values for the default mode of calculating type 2 integrals.
shell
- the shell of orbital basis functions to tabulate over
lstart
- the lowest angular momentum needed
lend
- the maximum angular momentum needed
r
- quadrature grid points
nr
- the number of grid points in r
start
- the grid point to start at
end
- the grid point to stop at
F
- the matrix to put the values in

memberdef.argsstring: (int maxL, int gridSize, const TwoIndex< double > &intValues, GCQuadrature &grid, std::vector< double > &values, int start, int end, int offset=0, int skip=1) const
memberdef.name: integrate

detaileddescription.para:
Performs the integration given the pretabulated integrand values.
maxL
- the maximum angular momentum needed
gridSize
- the number of quadrature points
intValues
- the TwoIndex<double> of pretabulated integrand values for each angular momentum needed
grid
- the quadrature grid
values
- the vector to put the resulting integrals into
start
- index of first point to integrate over
end
- index of last point to integrate over
offset
- the angular momentum to start at (defaults to 0)
skip
- the steps of angular momentum to go up in (defaults to 1)

memberdef.argsstring: (int N_min, int N_max, double p, double o_root_p, double P1, double P2, double P1_2, double P2_2, double X1, double X2, double oP1, double oP2, double *values) const
memberdef.name: compute_base_integrals

detaileddescription.para:
Computes the base integrals needed for the recursive type 2 integration. See ref. Shaw2017 for details.
N_min
- the lowest index of base integral needed (usually 2)
N_max
- the highest index of base integral needed
p
- the sum of shellA, shellB, and ECP exponents (p = a + b + n)
o_root_p
= 1/sqrt(p)
P1
= (a * A + b * B) / p where A, B are the magnitudes of distance of shellA and shellB from ECP
P2
= (b * B - a * A) / p
P1_2
= P1^2
P2_2
= P2^2
X1
= exp(p * P1^2 - a*A^2*b*B^2) / (16.0 * a * A * b * B)
X2
= exp(p * P2^2 - a*A^2*b*B^2) / (16.0 * a * A * b * B)
oP1
= 1 / P1 (P1 can't be zero as a, A, b, B, p > 0)
oP2
= 1 / P2 (set to zero if P2 = 0)
values
- array of size N_max - N_min + 1 in which results are returned

memberdef.argsstring: (int N, int l1, int l2, double n, double a, double b, double A, double B) const
memberdef.name: integrate_small

detaileddescription.para:
Performs a single radial quadrature over a small grid
N
- power of r in integrand
l1
- angular momentum of first Bessel function
l2
- angular momentum of second Bessel function
n
- exponent of ECP
a
- exponent of primitive in shellA
b
- exponent of primitive in shellB
A
- magnitude of distance of shellA from ECP
B
- magnitude of distance of shellB from ECP
a pair, where the first is the integral value, and the second is true if integration converged

briefdescription.para: Default constructor creates an empty object.

memberdef.argsstring: (int maxL, double tol=1e-15, int small=256, int large=1024)
memberdef.name: init

detaileddescription.para:
Initialises the object, in turn intialising the quadrature grids and BesselFunction
maxL
- the maximum angular momentum of integral needed
tol
- the tolerance for convergence of integrals (defaults to 1e-15)
small
- the maximum number of quadrature points for the small integration grid (default 256, minimum recommended)
large
- the maximum number of quadrature points for the large integration grid (default 1024, minimum recommended)

memberdef.argsstring: (const GaussianShell &shellA, const GaussianShell &shellB, const ShellPairData &data) const
memberdef.name: buildParameters

detaileddescription.para:
Given two GaussianShells, builds the parameters needed by both kind of integral.
shellA
- the first GaussianShell
shellB
- the second GaussianShell
data
- the data container for the shell pair
the parameters needed in both type 1 and 2 integrations

memberdef.argsstring: (int maxL, int N, int offset, const ECP &U, const GaussianShell &shellA, const GaussianShell &shellB, const ShellPairData &data, const Parameters &parameters, TwoIndex< double > &values) const
memberdef.name: type1

detaileddescription.para:
Calculates all type 1 radial integrals over two Gaussian shells up to the given maximum angular momentum.
maxL
- the maximum angular momentum
N
- the power of r that the integrand is weighted by
offset
- the starting angular momentum
U
- the ECP to be integrated over
shellA
- the first GaussianShell
shellB
- the second GaussianShell
data
- the data container for the shell pair
parameters
- pre-calculated parameters for the radial integral
values
- the matrix to return the integrals in

memberdef.argsstring: (int lam, int l1start, int l1end, int l2start, int l2end, int N, const ECP &U, const GaussianShell &shellA, const GaussianShell &shellB, const ShellPairData &data, const Parameters &parameters, TwoIndex< double > &values) const
memberdef.name: type2

detaileddescription.para:
Calculates all type 2 radial integrals over two Gaussian shells for the given ECP angular momentum l using quadrature
lam
- the ECP shell angular momentum to be calculated over
l1start
- the angular momentum to start on for the first shell
l1end
- the angular momentum to stop at for the first shell
l2start
- the angular momentum to start on for the second shell
l2end
- the angular momentum to stop at for the second shell
N
- the power of r that the integrand is weighted by
U
- the ECP to be integrated over
shellA
- the first GaussianShell
shellB
- the second GaussianShell
data
- the data container for the shell pair
parameters
- pre-calculated parameters for the radial integral
values
- the matrix to return the integrals in

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< Triple > &triples, int nbase, int lam, const ECP &U, const GaussianShell &shellA, const GaussianShell &shellB, double A, double B, ThreeIndex< double > &radials) const
memberdef.name: type2

detaileddescription.para: Calculates all the requested type 2 radial integrals using predominantly a recursive algorithm. In the triples, l1 must be less than or equal to l2. Symmetry means that for l1 > l2, {N, l1, l2} can be calculated as {N, l2, l1} but with shellA and shellB (And therefore also A and B) swapped.

parameterdescription.para: - vector of triples of form {N, l1, l2} of all required radial integrals
- the maximum number of base integrals that will be needed (so only have to compute once)
- the ECP shell angular momentum to be calculated over
- the ECP to be integrated over
- the magnitude of the distance of shellA from the ECP
- the magnitude of the distance of shellB from the ECP
- the array to return the integrals in, indexed as (N, l1, l2)

memberdef.argsstring: (int N, int l1, int l2, double n, double a, double b, double A, double B) const
memberdef.name: estimate_type2

detaileddescription.para: Estimates the value of the requested type 2 radial integral for prescreening, as described in ref. Shaw2017. The modal point is estimated by ignoring the ratios of bessel function derivatives - this gives an overestimate so is okay for screening, but would not be good for approximating the integral itself.

parameterdescription.para: - angular momentum of first Bessel function
- angular momentum of second Bessel function
- magnitude of distance of shellA from ECP
- magnitude of distance of shellB from ECP

simplesect.para: estimated value (upper bound) of the type 2 integral

briefdescription.para: Abstracts the calculation of radial integrals for ECP integration.

detaileddescription.para: This should not be used directly, and is owned by ECPIntegral. It provides the interface to the adaptive quadrature algorithms used to calculate the type 1 and 2 radial integrals, and the unrolled recursive scheme for type 2 radial integrals.
